intro: Thlaspi buxbaumii, commonly known as the Buxbaum's calea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue and are clustered in dense, showy inflorescences. Thlaspi buxbaumii is also known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
